10

Hillary Clinton hospitalized in New York with blood clot

The secretary of state's doctors discovered the clot stemming from the concussion she sustained earlier this month during a follow-up exam today, a spokesman said. She is being treated with anti-coagulants. (AP)

Maine man, 74, held in teenagers' deaths

A dispute about where the man's teenage tenants parked their cars during a snowstorm may have instigated the shooting, police said today. (AP)

Police probe two apparent BB gun shootings in Roslindale

One shooting shattered windows on a MBTA bus last night, while a female victim was hit in the face this afternoon, authorities said. (Boston Globe)

The Patriots have a team that can take them back to where it all began for Bill Belichick and Tom Brady, a Super Bowl in New Orleans.

UK’s austerity cuts a cautionary tale

England is implementing deep cuts in government spending as part of a multiyear plan to halt a widening budget gap, but two years of austerity have backfired.

So far in 2012, the best examples of bipartisanship have come from the right — and from somewhere other than Congress.

The Brattle Street bistro, a beacon for the arty and the academic, has shut its doors, its time, apparently, gone by.

Markey needs to find inner celebrity

Congressman Ed Markey won’t be facing the name power of Ben Affleck — who announced he won’t be running — but he still has the chance to act like a star.

Concord girds for ban on bottles

Businesses prepared to strip single-serving plastic water bottles from shelves as the town’s ban on the sale of them takes effect Tuesday.
